docs.snippet: American adolescents watch much more pornography than their parents know — and it’s shaping their ideas about pleasure, power and intimacy. Can they be taught to see it more critically?

headline.main: What Teenagers Are Learning From Online Porn

docs.snippet: More than 16 years after 9/11 spurred a broad fight against terrorism, some Americans say it’s time to look at how the country is deploying its forces.

headline.main: ‘An Endless War’: Why 4 U.S. Soldiers Died in a Remote African Desert

docs.snippet: The best teenage comments from last week’s writing prompts, and an invitation to join the conversation this week.

headline.print_headline: On the Shooting in Florida, Student Activism, ‘Black Panther’ and the Olympics: Our Favorite Student Comments of the Week
